cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/north-Gulf Coast, then forecast to sweep across the Southeast U.S. and move offshore near the Mid-Atlantic coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle (Apalachicola Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch nowhere north of Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown FL and Grand Isle LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning – Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle, interior Southeast, coastal Carolinas, and the Mid-Atlantic (including New Jersey) later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east to northeast winds possible Monday with a low (≤5%) chance of reaching tropical-storm force at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Delaware River/upper Delaware Bay during this event
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Monday into Tuesday as the storm passes offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding, high surf, and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore early next week
